page.title: 10PEGGLESWORTH FARM
page.content: The manager, Mr A'Barr, manages about 800 acres. Roughly 20% is woodland and the rest is arable crops apart from about thirty cattle and one hundred sheep. In the wood they shoot deer and sell them for Â£0.87 per lb. They also shoot ducks and rabbits. The farm owner, Mr Abad, has two polo pitches on which he plays polo with the king of Jordan's brother. They have 44 horses and ten grooms. They use electricity and have their own water supply which originates in Wales. Every field has a name; eg Grindstone field gets its name from the big stones there. The farm has four tractors, three ploughs, four small cultivators and one topper. The A'Barr family can trace their ancestors back to 1066.
